title: Shanghai Scallion Oil Noodles & Pork
instructions: Wash and dry the scallions thoroughly, then cut them into thin julienne strips. If you have extra, chop them up and save for the pork.
Cook the Chinese white noodles according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.

Heat 1/4 cup oil in a wok over medium heat. Add the scallions (whites first) and fry slowly, stirring occasionally, until they turn golden brown and crispy. This should take about 15-20 minutes. Be careful not to burn them.
Once done, remove the scallions from the oil and set aside on paper towels to drain excess oil. Reserve the scallion oil in the wok.
To the oil, add both the dark and light soy sauces along with the sugar. Use low heat and cook the mixture for about two minutes, until it starts to bubble up.

Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a separate pan over high heat. Add the ground pork and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces as it cooks. Stir in any extra chopped scallions and season with a bit of salt.
Mix everything together and top with crispy scallions.
